docs.text: Getting started with top reconstruction with ML This documentation will summarize the top anti-top final state reconstruction with machine learning (ML) algorithms. The studies will be done in the context of lepton+jet final state. Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs help - Print this help message. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Getting started with $ t\bar{t} $ resonance $ t\bar{t} $ resonance analysis searches for new physics in the top anti-top final state. top (anti-top) quark decays into a $ W^{+} (W^{-}) $ boson and a $ b (\bar{b}) $ quark in almost 99% cases. The $ W^{+} (W^{-}) $ boson further decays hadronically into two quarks with around 70% probability. In 10% cases the $ W^{+} (W^{-}) $boson decays into a lepton and a neutrino. $(".latex").latex();
docs.title: Event Topology

docs.text: $ t\bar{t} $ resonance analysis searches for new physics in the top anti-top final state. top (anti-top) quark decays into a $ W^{+} (W^{-}) $ boson and a $ b (\bar{b}) $ quark in almost 99% cases. The $ W^{+} (W^{-}) $ boson further decays hadronically into two quarks with around 70% probability. In 10% cases the $ W^{+} (W^{-}) $boson decays into a lepton and a neutrino. $(".latex").latex();
docs.title: Getting started with $t\bar{t}$ resonance
